intro: Salvia tiraquensis, commonly known as Tiraquén sage, is a perennial shrub native to the high Andes of Peru. It is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green leaves and spikes of violet to blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, high-altitude environments. Its medicinal properties have been traditionally used by indigenous communities for various health purposes. Botanically, it belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is known for its aromatic compounds and medicinal uses.
